title: Laundry Price Calculator UI (5 item types, button-based total)

requirements.summary: Add a Laundry Price Calculator UI with 5 item quantity inputs, per-item INR pricing, a Total Calculate button, and a displayed total starting at "Total: ₹0".
acceptanceCriteria: The UI contains 5 quantity inputs labeled in English: Shirt, Pant, Saree, Paithani Saree, Drilling Saree.
Each input defaults to 0 and is type=number with non-negative behavior.
A "Total Calculate" button exists; clicking it updates the displayed total.
The total display is rendered as "Total: ₹<number>" and starts at "Total: ₹0" on first load.
The computed total equals (shirtQty*10 + pantQty*10 + sareeQty*50 + paithaniQty*100 + drillingQty*150).

file_operations.description: Create a dedicated Laundry Price Calculator component that renders the 5 labeled quantity number inputs (defaulting to 0), a "Total Calculate" button, and a total display formatted exactly as "Total: ₹<number>" with initial value "Total: ₹0".
Wire the new LaundryPriceCalculator component into the existing UI (e.g., as a new section/card within the main content) so it is reachable on the current page without adding new routes.

requirements.summary: Add input validation so calculator quantities never go negative and invalid/empty values are treated as 0 to avoid NaN or negative totals.
acceptanceCriteria: Entering a negative number results in the stored quantity being clamped to 0 (or the UI preventing negatives).
If a quantity field is cleared (empty), the calculator treats it as 0 and total calculation still works.
Total never displays NaN and never displays a negative value.

file_operations.description: Implement non-negative numeric parsing/clamping for each quantity input (e.g., enforce min=0 and clamp parsed values); treat empty/invalid input as 0 during calculation so the rendered total never becomes NaN or negative.

requirements.summary: Ensure all calculator user-facing text is English-only (heading, labels, button text, and total label).
acceptanceCriteria: All calculator-related labels and messages are English-only.

file_operations.description: Audit and enforce that all calculator-related UI strings (heading, item labels, button label, and "Total: ₹…" display) are English-only and match the BuildRequest wording where specified.
